meanings.definition: Having or showing a bold, provocative, or unconventional quality.
meanings.sent1: She wore the edgiest outfit to the party, with bright colors and unique patterns.
meanings.sent2: The artist's edgiest paintings always attracted a lot of attention at the gallery.
meanings.sent3: His joke about wearing a tie-dye suit to a formal event was the edgiest thing he had ever said.
meanings.sent4: The comedian's humor had the edgiest tone, making the audience both laugh and think.
meanings.sent5: The edgiest hairstyle of the season was a combination of neon colors and asymmetrical cuts.

meanings.definition: Most intense or extreme in a particular quality or aspect.
meanings.sent1: The spiciest chili in the competition was also the edgiest, leaving everyone reaching for water.
meanings.sent2: The storm last night was the edgiest one we've experienced this year, with thunder and lightning.
meanings.sent3: The race to the finish line became the edgiest moment of the entire tournament.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was the edgiest in the choir, standing out with its powerful and emotional tone.
meanings.sent5: The edgiest flavor of ice cream at the shop was a mix of jalapeno and chocolate chips.
